Thank you for uploading these episodes! Yet I'm having previously mentioned problems with viewing some of the episodes, using VLC.

Episodes 1 and 2 work fine, excellent quality/size ratio. :) But episode 3 makes VLC freeze, as do 4,5,6,7,8,12 and 13. Episodes 9,10, and 11 work fine.

It might be due to corrupt file downloads, but I've never before had that problem, and it would be unlikely to affect so many of the files. However, if these work for others, the problem must be on my end. Going to download the bugged files again --->

If anyone else is experiencing said problems and manages to find a solution, please share it :D

Edit to my previous post: Tried DL:ing the corrupt files a second time, still had the same problem: Upon starting with VLC, the player freezes and when trying to quit the program crashes.

I find this really peculiar, it can't be due to codecs since some of the vids (1,2,9,10,11) work perfectly. I can't even guess what the cause may be, but am hoping for someone to tell how to fix this, as I'd like to see the episodes :)

Further to my issues above, sorted it by downloading the X-Lite Codec Pack from:

I'm not deaf man. I find subs very distracting.
I spend the whole time reading ahead of the actor and waiting for him to say the words. I can't enjoy anything with subs unless its not in english. I just want to watch it, not read it. and I can't stop myself from reading words when they are on a screen I am looking at....

I'm using a mac so i don't have the option of dl'ing any codec packs besides additional QT codecs, (We all know QT is shitty) so i am stuck using a standard VLC copy.

The only way i can get episodes 3,4,5,6,7,8,12,and 13 working is by running an episode that works and while it's playing start one of the episodes that doesn't work.

This, to me, seems like an error in the file. As the files that don't work are the ones with soft coded english subs i think they might be the problem. But i don't know much about video formats so i don't really know.

Any other mac users having this problem?

You guys still don't know how to play MKV's? FFS... Google it. Take your pick: Codec pack (like CCCP, or just an MKV splitter). Or: Media player (like Zoom Player, VLC, MPC). Or: Remux H264/AAC into MP4 contrainer. Etc.
